website_summaries.verdict: For those who can reach the top of a taller rack, this sturdy choice made of metal offers a lot of storage for a good price.
pros: Metal rack is not heavy, but it can handle a lot of weight and looks attractive
Plenty of hanging spots at an affordable price

customer_reviews.title: Held up the second floor of my home in a fire. Buy this.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great coat rack for my home! It was very sturdy and balanced well. My house set fire in May 2015 - the entire house was a loss. In this picture you can see that this coat rack actually held up the second floor that collapsed. I recommend this product to anyone, for both hanging coats and a safety net for your second floor in case it collapses in fire.
customer_reviews.author: chris LaGambina

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The screws won’t fit through the holes, even using a drill with a hex head bit. Why don’t sellers do quality control!?! Update-Amazon corrected this, sent a new base and I was able to put it together. Being tall I love the height, it has lots of hanging areas, coats on the large pegs with hats and gloves on the small ones. Very useful and due to Amazons great customer service would repurchase for downstairs entryway.
customer_reviews.author: Tosno

customer_reviews.title: Defective, wobbly, unsafe...
customer_reviews.text: Gave me a headache until I just gave up REALIZING that the bottom legs, no matter how you fight to adjust them just don't work. The way this is MADE is utterly defective.. it wobbles to the point of hazard and is very unsafe...touch it and it falls over. Bought 2...put one together and that was IT. Put felt pads under the legs to even them out as best I could and put it on carpet to stabilize it more. THE OTHER ONE IS goIng BACK...wont go through the aggravation or headache of this horrible product again. F- Choose something else or have the ibuprofen ready...what a pain!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sleepless in NC

customer_reviews.title: Best For The Money!
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for a nice looking full-sized black metal coat rack. I kept finding ones at home decor stores and furniture stores that were crooked yet were $50-100! This is nice looking, sturdy, easy to assemble and full-sized. I just assembled it myself in about 20 minutes, taking the most time to adjust the bottom screws a few times to get a secure, non-wobbly and STRAIGHT base! I can’t handle crooked stuff coat racks, Christmas trees, hanging pictures, etc. 😉 Tested hanging heavy coats on this rack and it does very well. Great coat rack for the money!
customer_reviews.author: K. Robben

customer_reviews.title: Great entryway solution for a family of five
customer_reviews.text: After the wooden coatrack in the corner of our entry was knocked/fell over for the millionth time and broke, I looked for one to replace it and landed upon the Frenchi Furniture Black Metal Coat Rack. It was easy to assemble. My toddler and preschooler have yet to knock this one over, and it balances coats far better than our previous wooden rack did. I love the lower layer of hooks, as do my three children. They love that they can reach to hang up their own jackets and get them down. It's sturdy, balanced well, and is thus far holding up well to the daily use of a family of five. I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah P

customer_reviews.title: Not even a drunk spring breaker can wobble more than this coat rack
customer_reviews.text: It's truly a shame that I have to give this such a low rating but it is unusable. I Assembled the coat rack to find that the feet of the rack do not screw into the base. Not only that but the holes in which the screws insert are several sizes larger. What does this mean? The otherwise very sturdy and modern looking coat rack is capable of standing unassisted without load for about 3 seconds before it list to the side more than the Costa Concordia.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hard pass. Wish I could return it, but I'd have to take it apart. It's a beast to put together bc the holes are not well designed. It's super cheap. The wrench it came with stripped after 4 screws. I did finish putting it together bc I had my own wrench, but it doesn't stand up straight. It looks awful. Absolutely terrible. :(
customer_reviews.author: wingnut

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for wasting 2 hours of my life
customer_reviews.text: This product would be nice if you could put it together. The top half took me over 2 hours because it was so poorly manufactured and it completely destroyed my hands in the process. After all that I come to find out the bottom half won't even go together. The screws just slide out of the holes that have been drilled for them in the base and the poles that are supposed to screw together absolutely cannot because the pre-placed screw is loose and just spins making it impossible to twist them together. Thanks for wasting 2 hours of my life.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L Host

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra money and get a better one.
customer_reviews.text: Wrong part or poorly designed. I have two Part A which is the leg that supports the unit instead of 1 part A and 1 part B. Problem with having two of the same leg, makes it so that the unit isnt balanced. You will see it in the Video. I dont know if its just me but this obviously isnt correct. And I also get another hook for absolutely no reason.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Sim

customer_reviews.title: Damaged parts and missing parts
customer_reviews.text: The plastic piece (part I) came shattered in many pieces. Also didn’t receive the Allen key, or part K, which fastens the top part of the rack to the bottom, rendering it a safety hazard especially for young children. Amazon offers no option to simply order the missing or damaged parts, without having to pack the whole thing back up and return it. It’s going in the trash. I’m amazed that this has the generally good feedback it has.
customer_reviews.author: An honest reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Total quality control failure
customer_reviews.text: Well..again a cheap product from some company who cares less about making sure the consumer can assemble it. All the holes where the screws go in are too small and after getting the first two sections together with sore fingers from forcing the screws in it came to the base...the holes are so small there is no way the screw will thread into them. Total piece of junk and it is going back. This product should not be sold on Amazon. I would give it negative 5 stars because this is totally unacceptable. DON’T BUY!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: j hook

customer_reviews.title: The reviews are as crooked as this coat rack
customer_reviews.text: Nothing I hate more then seeing something with a ton of five-star reviews, buying the product, and seeing that it is garbage. Missing the bottom plastic on one of the legs so it was wobbly, the entire post is crooked and the top round ornamental piece is misshaped. This is garbage and the reviews have likely been paid for. Not fun to assemble because it was near impossible to get the screws in the tiny holes. Don't believe these reviews, try a different product.
customer_reviews.author: C. S

customer_reviews.title: I should have heeded the bad reviews
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super flimsy and the base is not only wobbly and uneven but also super easy to bend the parts. We don't trust it at all. My husband is going to mount the base on a sturdy piece of wood because I'm just over it and don't want to bother taking it apart to send it back. Hopefully, our redneck engineering works. SAVE YOUR MONEY AND YOUR SANITY! DON'T BUY THIS PIECE OF $^*&!
customer_reviews.author: S Jones

customer_reviews.title: Wobbles
customer_reviews.text: This coat tree does not sit flat on the floor no matter what we do. It tips over very easily so we need to make sure we put certain coats on certain hooks. The finial at the top sits cockeyed, but it doesn’t matter if you have coats up there so you don’t have to see it. The good points: Assembly was easy. I do like that it has three tiers so you can hang belts and scarves at different levels.
customer_reviews.author: PanDayumm

customer_reviews.title: Easily assembled and easily moved from room to room.  Holds lots of coats and hats
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mud/laundry room. My husband walks our dog daily. He would come in the house and throw his coat on top of the washer or folded over the laundry sink. It not only looked messy, it made it difficult to do laundry. I was going to put up wall hooks, but the door would bump them. I decided to try this coat rack and I love it. It was easily assembled and fits right in a corner out of the way. We've already placed coats and hats on it and can't believe how many it holds. During the holidays it can be moved to hold visitor's coats. I would buy this again and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Licht

customer_reviews.title: Nice materials but very wobbly
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is quite good for a cheap coat rack. But the wobbliness is intense. You'll have to put something under one of the legs and still it won't be completely sturdy. Legs are not adjustable, neither is the rubber tip in the end. So keep that in mind when buying. I'll keep it for a while in my closet until the pandemic is over and I don't have to keep some of the clothes separately. After that - bye bye wobbly thing.
customer_reviews.author: Sungmin Lee

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my office. The screw post on the top was bent when I took it out of the box, but I managed to get it together and it didn't look too bad. When I hang my heavy leather jacket from this rack, it doesn't worry me that it's going to fall over or bend, so the construction is pretty strong. It does look nice in my office, so that's a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan P

customer_reviews.title: I read all of the negative reviews and I didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I read all of the negative reviews and I didn't experience any of the issues! Mine went together in 15 minutes. I built it on a a concrete floor. Zero wobble. I get some of the concerns re: the base being too narrow. I wouldn't use it for heavy items. I am using it for baseball hat's, sweatshirts, running gear etc. Not heavy winter coats.
customer_reviews.author: Joe H.

customer_reviews.title: Fine
customer_reviews.text: Kept in the basement (gets cold even in the summer) for spare jackets and sweaters so I don't have to go up 2 flights of stairs if I get chilly in my office. Works a treat, easy enough to put together although some of the pieces were not quite right, they eventually slotted in properly with a bit of elbow grease. Very wobbly but if you aren't going to use it much and it just sits there I suppose that's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unstable and cheap
customer_reviews.text: I have never given only 1 star before. It took over an hour to put together, it looks cheap, it was cheap, it is way too tall, and very unstable. It was for my office, but I'm taking it home to use with my clothes covering it so I don't have to look at it. If the boxes and such were not already tossed out, I would have returned it. Very disappointed in the product. Sad I wasted the money. Not advised to purchase this, find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy J Unison Pace

customer_reviews.title: Avoid by any Means necessary....
customer_reviews.text: This was the worse. If you don’t use a drill you will destroy your hands in the process Even with a drill, the rack came with one crumpled up piece of paper for instructions not helpful at all. Not easy to put together. As a result, put together wrong. I Just want to throw it down the hill like a javelin. Not worth your time or frustration. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: +MF+

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but light
customer_reviews.text: The rack seems nice but I actually couldn’t get it to stay up without falling over without many things on it and the weight evenly distributed. I had to use a bungee cord to keep it standing up or else it would fall over. Otherwise it’s nice to look at but it’s too light.
customer_reviews.author: jejohnson0625

customer_reviews.title: One screw hole not properly threaded
customer_reviews.text: This is the version with 4 legs. It appears that reviews for various models are all lumped together. All the parts were in the box. Picture assembly diagram was easy to follow. The only problem, one screw hole in Section B (the middle section of the pole) was not properly drilled and threaded. Unable to put that screw in, thus 4 stars instead of 5. Fortunately, that missing screw is not critical, so I will let it go. Bought this metal coat/hat tree to hold towels next to our spa. I think it will do the job, and the price was reasonable. Seems sturdy. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: 805reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great coat rack!
customer_reviews.text: The coat rack came in generic packaging, but sufficient to keep it from being damaged in shipping. Everything was there, including the tools, but if I had to do it again I'd put a hex bit in a power tool. The legs are somewhat bendable because they're hollow tubes, but in a 200+ year old house, that's a benefit! Most people complained it didn't sit perfectly level, but our floors aren't level at all, so it was to my advantage. It's a coat rack, so you'll need to distribute the weight, but we haven't had any issues with it tipping over.
customer_reviews.author: rlandis8

customer_reviews.title: Solid coat rack
customer_reviews.text: This coat rack is much better than I expected. I thought it would be flimsy, unbalanced when loaded and otherwise cheap ~ NOT. This is an excellent coat rack. It was no harder to put together than another DIY furniture and in fact I hardly swore at all and did not cut myself. It's the kind of thing you'll put together once and leave assembled, you won't be breaking it down for a move for example. So, I highly recommend this coat rack! Excellent choice! Buy it now.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Proctor

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to assemble with missing screws and holes that didn’t perfectly line up. However, after compensating for those assembly deficiencies, we like the coat rack. Looks good and is sturdy metal instead of wood that broke on us in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Seascape

customer_reviews.title: Not well built
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together, which is a plus. My issue is it DOES NOT stand straight. It leans to one side. Took the bottom piece apart and assembled it again with the same results. I would return it, but having to disassemble it again is a bit of a pain. Will have to figure out how I will use it...maybe distribute weight. Either way, I am not thrilled with this product.
customer_reviews.author: ERL

customer_reviews.title: Straight into the dumpster
customer_reviews.text: I really cannot stress enough how much of a complete piece of garbage this is. As assembled, all four legs don't touch the floor, meaning that the entire unit wobbles on three legs, making it completely unusable without adjustment which involved manually bending the cheap metal (yes, so soft it can be bent by hand) to get it a little closer to what seemed like stability - until i tried actually putting coats on it. Oh, and one of the bolts was completely smooth; they couldn't even be bothered to finish machining their threads
customer_reviews.author: asdfghjkl

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts and cheaply made!
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made! Started putting mine together and one foot stand is missing both plastic inserts, so makes it wobbly and metal in contact with my wood floors to scratch them! Then i noticed im missing 1 lower bottom hook! So with all that said its going back to where it came from!
customer_reviews.author: Edith O

customer_reviews.title: Tall as a door, not sturdy as a tree.
customer_reviews.text: I’m super iffy about this. It came scuffed to begin with and the tool you have to use to put the screws in is sharp so it easy scratches the paint right off even more. It really hurt my hand to use. The instructions were easy enough to understand but the actual building process was awful. I’m really severely doubting it was worth the price. Disappointed. Maybe it’s faulty, maybe I’m just awful at putting things together. Just be wary...
customer_reviews.author: 🍓 Me o w 🖤

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.text: I am making it work because it’s not worth the hassle of returning. Arrived in a damaged box with parts just thrown in together willy nilly. The base screw cover was broken. One of the hooks is loose and cannot be tightened because holes were out of alignment, the screws had to be forced, and the threads were damaged. It does not stand up straight. Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: Subtract one star from the overall rating.
customer_reviews.text: The perils of shopping online for items of this nature, and price, were borne out with this purchase. Pieces missing, malformed attachment items. Quality was as expected for the price point, a slight step above instant garbage. Some manufacturers of items requiring assembly have a number to call for handling issues like this. Sure would have been nice. To return the item would have required transportation costs that exceed the amount spent. The Amazon rep gave an impressive effort given the constraints of this item. * * * * * for their efforts. Please give serious thought to a different coat rack.
customer_reviews.author: RevTekkX

customer_reviews.title: Not made for winter coats....
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to receive the new coat rack and put it together immediately. When I hung our coats on it I noticed the leg started to bend. I took the legs off and made a wooden base thinking that would be more secure. Then when hanging one of the heavier winter coats on one of the hooks, that also bent. I was very disappointed in this coat rack and I will be contacting the company for a refund. Please see the attached pictures for the stress points on the different pieces of this coat rack.
customer_reviews.author: vfulford

customer_reviews.title: Premium on a budget
customer_reviews.text: For the cost this really is a premium coat rack. Mine arrived with a few minor scratches/ chips mostly around the screw holes. Once its all assembled though you can't really tell and my guest think its an expensive premium coat rack unless they take the time to inspect it up close. My only complaint is the feet are not wide enough to handle heavy loads without proper balancing. I live in a cold environment so this primarily holds snow coats. Just make sure to alternate how you hang things and its not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not awesome
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The product will hold stuff up off the floor if balanced carefully. Cons: Holes were not symmetrically aligned so no matter what ended up not straight. After (very frustrating) assembly the product leans to one side so looks goofy in the room, but the way it is made makes it impossible to straighten. I would NOT recommend purchasing this unless you do t care that it is cheaply made and of generally low quality.
customer_reviews.author: MamaOf4

customer_reviews.title: This is a great coat rack
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something we could use for both coats and swim suits/towels. This works great. I was able to eliminate the middle section to make it lower, because it is a very tall coat rack and we aren't using it in an entry way. I wanted something a little lower that is more discreet and easier for the kids to reach. With a few modifications it is working great as a multi-purpose coat rack and drying rack in our sunroom. The quality of this is very good. It is sturdy, well made, and looks very nice. I highly recommend this as a great priced, great quality standing coat rack!
customer_reviews.author: ShopToo

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Easy to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to put together. I am short so I put the hooks on the top part first so I could reach. All pieces went together snug and tight and very sturdy. Has a small footprint, and with limited space, I am able to put a lot of coat and hats in a small area. Has 4 legs which makes it very stable and I am able to place our coat on it without the worry of it tipping. Great product.....highly recommend and would buy again if I needed a 2nd one. All parts are high quality powder coated metal.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Viitala

customer_reviews.title: Pretty crooked and un-even
customer_reviews.text: Finish is fairly nice- even though it will scratch easily. My main problem with it is the legs are pretty un-even, so I had to put a spacer under one leg, and it still feels wobbly. Also, the main pole is not straight up and down from the legs. The hooks seem nice and I will still try to use it (just assembled it tonight) but not happy that it is so un-even and not straight even though I tried to spin the pole to make it as straight up and down as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Chixdigit

customer_reviews.title: Basic Rack, Works As Intended
customer_reviews.text: There isn't much to say about this except, it works. See the attached picture to see how it looks next to my front door. I do kinda wish it had more "flair" and more hooks. I had to take away 1 star because the package was missing exactly 1 screw (the bag of screws had 19x part "J", instead of 20x). If the manufacturer sees this review and mails me the 1 missing screw, I'll be glad to change this review to 5 stars. Other than that... this is a solid piece for the $21 price. I mean, what do we really want for $21 standing coat rack for a bachelor pad? This is just about right for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chinedu P. Opara

customer_reviews.title: Rickety and broken.
customer_reviews.text: When I got this, one of the balls at the end of a hook was missing. Also, there's a plastic piece that covers the screws that attach the legs to the center pole, and that was cracked although still usable. Once we assembled the base and the pole, the whole thing leaned to one side, and it didn't look like it would hold a heavy jacket without falling over (although we didn't fully assemble it to check). Also, we couldn't get it to stop rocking a little, like one of the two leg pieces was bent or at an angle to the other. All in all, I returned it to look for another, sturdier, coat rack.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Gelvin - DRTTMK

customer_reviews.title: Broken arm on upper
customer_reviews.text: We used the rack for a few months...the arm couldn't support the weight of my carhart winter coat and broke off. the rest of the rack is fine and we like it...I just have to be careful about hanging my heavy coats in the same area.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: What's Not To Love?
customer_reviews.text: I know purchasing a coat rack isn't exactly rocket science, but if you're like me, what ever you put in your house you want to @ least like, ok? So, laugh if you must, but I did research other coat racks. Kept coming back to this one, hands down. When it came and was put together, getouttatown!! This rack is sturdy, stands firm even when family's over and the rack should have exceeded it's maximum. But, with all my fam's put this coat rack thru, it came thru like a champ. And just kept looking good. The price, no one would ever know. And it looks simply divine....
customer_reviews.author: SynDrella

customer_reviews.title: a little precarious
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, and looks decent. Technically it does the job, but you have to be strategic about what you hang where. If the base had any weight to it, it would be much less precarious, but the whole thing is very light, so you have to keep weight distribution in mind, when you're hanging anything heavier than a fleece jacket on it.
customer_reviews.author: George Savage

customer_reviews.title: This product is not steady and one of the leg wobbles a lot. Not a good purchase.
customer_reviews.text: It does not stand right without moving/tilting over. One of the base is not correctly aligned to the length of other 3 and is shorter. This keeps wobbling over when try to hand a light weight jacket(did not dare to try a heavy jacket) and it toppled on my feet and had a sprain. I threw away the box immediately after opening thinking this will solve the purpose. Highly disappointed and not worth at all for the money. Cannot even send it back as the box it came is recycled already.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon fan

customer_reviews.title: WARNING:  ITEM PRESENTS A SIGNIFIGANT, REAL AND PRESENT DANGER.
customer_reviews.text: Item is improperly engineered and built. the legs are too short. without warning, this item will tip over unpredictably. falling onto anyone who happens to be near it. items to be placed on it must be very, very carefully weighed and the weight evenly distributed or item will tip over, often directly toward the person (particularly children) attempting to place hats, coats, scarves or other things on its various hooks. this has happened already. it now stands bare in our home, an obvious monument to poor engineering. there is no warning included with this item in the parts container. please advise.
customer_reviews.author: michael d.

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I would love to say I liked it but it had so many missing components I am unable to put it together. I was also a idiot and left it laying in the package for a month without opening so now I can't even return it.
customer_reviews.author: Sha

customer_reviews.title: i cant believe this thing is 20 bucks
customer_reviews.text: i literally just opened it and got it together, and i cant believe this thing is priced where it is. it feels super sturdy and is much taller than i expected! it seemed like it might be kind of wobbly at first but i put some back packs on it and it seemed get sturdier. so far so good, if anything changes i will update this but i think this was a great buy and it feels very quality! If youre reading this review, just do it, i guarantee youve spent $20ish on worse things.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica reuter

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and functional
customer_reviews.text: This coat rack is great. It was taller than I expected it to be, but that’s good because I have long coats. It holds my heavy winter coats no problem and doesn’t take up too much space in my small apartment.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Product looks great but quality is very poor
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the product in pictures and general reviews were positive. So I bought this coat rack. It was easy to assemble it together and it worked great for a month and then the hooks started to bend. It's just me and my wife and we have 2 coats each which should not be a problem for this coat rack but due to poor quality, I am down to 9 hooks now because 3 hooks so far are damage beyond repair now and I am thinking to buy another one soon because after loosing the first hook, it has lost it's balance too and will fall if you don't place all coats strategically on it. Will not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Muhammad M.

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: It's not particularly attractive but it's sturdy and serves its purpose. The top hooks accommodate heavier items well, without concern for it tipping over. Assembly took 20-30 minutes. Comes with a one of those small hex wrenches included with furniture requiring assembly. Recommend having a better one on hand to lessen time and frustration.
customer_reviews.author: anonamiss

customer_reviews.title: Screw driver with alan head required.
customer_reviews.text: Listen closely. Its great and sturdy and holds a lot of weight. With that said, dont think you are going to put this together in less than 4 hours with an alan key included. You must use at minimum a screw driver with alan head. At best a ratchetable screw driver with alan head. Try not to use a screw gun as it may strip the screws. With the ratchetable screw driver it took me an hour with zero stress.
customer_reviews.author: truth sayer

customer_reviews.title: Not Balanced - Not Sturdy - Not Recommended
customer_reviews.text: We Tried two of this model, and no matter how hard you tried, it was impossible to adjust the legs for a balanced stance. We fixed the balance by putting pieces of cardboard under a leg. But the stability is now under question. One of the hands bent and broke by hanging two or three jackets. Unfortunately, it happened after one month when we could not return the product. I would find something more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: My partner: “how did this pass the muster I cannot believe how blatantly wobbly this is. “
customer_reviews.text: My partner is an experienced “diy”er and neurotic follower of assembly instructions. As such I know any errors in assembly are product oriented alone. It wobbles enough that a coat on one end might spill the coats balancing on another , or maybe topple the whole silly thing over. The bottom assembly is rickety at best. He duct taped card board to the bottom for a sense of durability if that gives you any indication. Now I’m frugal and often like to go with less expensive options on basics. I like to “get my moneys” worth but this thing just doesn’t fit together right. Please just do yourself a favor and spend a few extra bucks on something that functions.
customer_reviews.author: spongedweller

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I've been looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Moved into a new apartment and been throwing my coats over the back of my couch. I had a little corner where a coat rack would fit but had no luck finding one that was affordable til I found this one. It's a little unsteady, but even with one heavy coat on one side, it still stays standing and you can't beat the price. It's very heavy duty and well made and I couldn't believe it was so inexpensive. I'm very happy with this coat rack!
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Stable
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy, very practical. Haven't noticed any wobbliness on either carpet or hardwood. The feet are wide enough to be stable so it doesn't tip over unless all the weight is shifted to one side. The only problem I had with it was while putting together the top and lower halves. No parts seemed bent, but as I screwed them together, they stayed at a slight angle (less than 10 degrees). I tried it again a couple of times, but it always looked the same. Then again, I didn't see any bend, but it's not impossible I unknowingly forced it too much during assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Gui Oba

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit
customer_reviews.text: I have bought and assembled 4 of these "Coat Racks". They are used in different rooms in our home, and are extremely useful for hanging all kinds of clothing. The unit is very well designed and is very sturdy. I have only positive comments about the unit. My only negative regards the instructions. If you look very carefully at the assembly instructions drawing you can figure out how to put the unit together. There are no step by step instructions only the diagram. It is worth figuring it out and assembled this unit that will last for many years!
customer_reviews.author: Digital camera Pioneer

customer_reviews.title: Very unsatisfied with parts.
customer_reviews.text: #####REALISTIC REVIEW##### YOU MAY CONSIDER TO BUY THIS PRODUCT WHEN YOU SEE MY REVIEW 2020-01-04 Very unhappy with this product. Can't contact to the seller. Some screw are not cut and fitting at all. First pic shows that the screw is not fitting to the rack at all because there is no cut. Second pic shows that since first screw is not working, it just falls down Third and fourth pics show that the one of hanger parts is not sturdy. The camera angle is same in 3rd and 4th pics and you can see the part is moved and shaken.
customer_reviews.author: Darren S Endo

customer_reviews.title: Large and well designed for ease of use
customer_reviews.text: Took hubby less than 20 minutes to assemble. Stands quite tall and seems and looks very sturdy. It is a large piece. The length of top rungs is long...coats hang out and away from anything underneath on lower rungs which makes for easy removal and hanging of stuff. Love this piece. We got black and its a dark glossy black not matte.
customer_reviews.author: Ss

customer_reviews.title: Defective piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: The threads and screws do not line up properly and make this item impossible to put together. Can't get the top hooks screwed in because the entire 2nd row of holes are all too small for the screws so the threads won't catch. Save your money and look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Great coat rack for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great coat rack for the price! The reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is due to weight distribution - the bottom support piece of the rack is very light, so if you place heavier coats/jackets in the top portion, the rack will tip over. However, this is easily dealt with by simply placing your heaviest 4 items on the lowest 4 arms, which keeps the rack in place without any problems. Overall I am very happy with this purchase, and if I ever need another coat rack in the future I would not hesitate to buy this model again.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Holds everyday essentials with ease!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a quick grab and go person. I put my hat, jacket and crossbody bag on it so I know exactly where my stuff is when I’m running out the door to work. Mines a little wobbly, user error maybe.
customer_reviews.author: DavidMZavala

customer_reviews.title: Good value - nicely constructed
customer_reviews.text: I was dubious of this but based on reviews, took the chance. Often these metal things have misaligned holes drilled, missing pieces etc. The directions were easy to understand (I just looked at the pictures), all of the pre-drilled holes aligned perfectly. It's sturdy, nicely made and I am very pleased. It even came with an Allen Wrench, so I didn't have to go raid hubby's tool box.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: THEY GAVE ME THE WRONG SCREWS AND HORRIBLE DIRECTIONS. THE BASE LEGS AND STAND WON'T HOLD ...
customer_reviews.text: THEY GAVE ME THE WRONG SCREWS AND HORRIBLE DIRECTIONS. THE BASE LEGS AND STAND WON'T HOLD TOGETHER AS THE SCREWS AREN'T EVEN LONG ENOUGH TO FIT THROUGH THEM AND ONLY ONE TYPE OF SCREW WAS PROVIDED. STRIPPED MULTIPLE TOOLS TRYING TO GET THEM OUT BECAUSE THEY ALSO BECAME STUCK. NOW HAVE TO BUY A NEW COAT RACK AND NEW TOOLS FOR MY OWN TOOLBOX.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly
customer_reviews.text: Was fairly easy to assemble and it looks nice. However, it is not level. The legs are not aligned correctly and it is quite wobbly. I'll probably be looking to return this for my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Much larger and substantial than visualized, but that's good. What's not great is that after I attached the "feet" on both of the stands I purchased, they're not even and the stand wobbled back and forth. I had to add furniture non-skid pads to balance the stands.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Todd

customer_reviews.title: Poorly crafted
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty handy at following instructions and assembling things, but this was not very easy to assemble, the screws did not all screw in very well and when it finally was assembled it wobbled. I am very disappointed, but not so much so that I want to bother disassembling the whole thing to return it. Also, when I got it a screw was missing to I had to improvise with my own tools.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of boys

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, and at this price point I didn't expect much. It can't handle the uneven distribution of much weight (one winter coat on one side balanced by a lighter leather coat on the other made it visibly tilt to the side of the former). The little round caps put on the ends fell off so often and so easily I had to fix it with superglue on the insides. Other than those two significant issues, it looks pretty good and has held up so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Another Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how well these racks work, I bought 2. They were easy to assemble and they hold more then I expected. The only issue is do not hang heavy coats on the top-most arms, the rack will tip over. I hang light jackets and rain coats on them as well as my hats. Also, when on tipped over there was no damage or bending. A very sturdy product.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Guzowsky

customer_reviews.title: Great coat rack must have
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my office. I have had it a few months and love it. It is very very sturdy. Love the look. Many complements. I have computer bags, my purse and book bags hanging from it without any feel of being unstable. Very pleased!! I would highly recommend. I kept it in two pieces in my car to transport to my office and easily snapped it together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised by the quality since I only paid $18. I bought it as an open box item. Everything was still wrapped as if it had never been opened. The only downside is that the legs rock a little. I have it on a hardwood floor, so I am thinking I'll put it in my laundry room where there is carpet. Another thing is to watch for cross threading the screws. I had one that refused to go in straight no matter what hole I used... It is in but not tight.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will be able to pass it on to my grandkids
customer_reviews.text: WOW, OMG, Holy Cow- impressive packaging, much sturdier than expected, easy assembly, quick too... never been so impressed with a product!!! Good design & quality!!
customer_reviews.author: James R Tenbus

customer_reviews.title: coat rack, 73"
customer_reviews.text: This coat rack had lots of hanging hooks so will be ideal for not only coats and jackets but as a place near the door for umbrella and hats....looks super cool, very tall, love it a lot. Recommend for anyone who wants to have easy access to outerwear; small footprint also a plus. Assembly was easy for this unskilled assembler, should be likewise for you.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Amazing coat rack
customer_reviews.text: This coat is seriously more than I expected! I have nothing bad to say about it. I am amazed how much it can hold. And it is so well made and very sturdy. Excellent metal/paint quality. Stands perfectly, does not rock. It is taller than I am! So make sure the height will work for you! I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: American consumer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving this two stars because I’m keeping the product, but if you want something study and reliable, this isn’t your bet. Was missing 4 screws, came with extras we didn’t need, and the legs were crooked and too short so the rack was uneven — my husband had to bend and shape them to make it stand straight. Half of the hooks that hang off it are held one with one screw instead of 2 to make up for the missing ones we didn’t receive. Not really worth it, even if it was cheap!
customer_reviews.author: JLM

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as I hoped and expected
customer_reviews.text: Even sturdier than I actually expected on the main parts, though the legs can be "adjusted" for straightness by simply bending them by hand. It hasn't started to bend to anything yes despite being against a wall and thus all of the weight is on one side. My only complaint is that things on hangars don't hang well from the top prongs, just sink to the middle, they really only work for hats and not well for ball caps.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B

customer_reviews.title: It Leans
customer_reviews.text: I was excited and assembled it - the powder coated metal seemed so sturdy, but it leans!! No contact info for the seller so I am leaving this review instead. You should have followed up with customers like other sellers do to make sure they got a satisfactory product. I’m quite disappointed and don’t want this thing now....
customer_reviews.author: Hair Maven

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces twice
customer_reviews.text: Whoever is packing these boxes needs to be talked to. The first time the box had two "C" pieces and no "B" piece. Was supposed to be one "B" and one "C" piece. So I put in a return. Couple of days later, the new one arrives and its missing 4 screws. Luckily I hadnt sent back the first one yet so I took the 4 screws from there. But thats 2 packages in a row that were missing parts.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Asturias

customer_reviews.title: Trash and bolts dont fit!
customer_reviews.text: DO. NOT. WASTE. YOUR. MONEY OR TIME. After 20 mins with my husband we still were not able to assemble it. The top accent piece does not screw in right and the cheap plastic bottom cover on the bottom broke because it was too small to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: GenieLooLoo

customer_reviews.title: Tall and holds a lot!
customer_reviews.text: This coat rack holds a lot! It was very easy to assemble and everything fit as it should. I have read posts where people got racks that didn't assemble properly (sorry)... This coat rack is very tall!!! I am 5'3 and can just barely get a sweatshirt on and off the top (FYI) So, if you are shorter this might not work for you. The only "wonky" thing (even though I gave it 5 starts all around) is that it leans slightly maybe 5° but it doesn't bother me. Overall, a great coat rack!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan G.

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy and looks great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item as a cheap quick fix for the many jackets that have been collecting around my house and this rack works great. Its very tall and hangs many jackets. The only thing I wish it had was an umbrella rack in the middle
customer_reviews.author: Emily G.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the holidays!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to put next to the back door for the holidays when we were going to have lots of people coming and going. It arrived promptly and was easy to put together. The four legs make it very stable and we have had no issues of it wanting to tip, regardless of where coats were placed on it, or how many. The multi layers of pegs also meant that a) coats were spread out, and b) everyone could comfortably reach them. At under $20 this was a great find.
customer_reviews.author: Patience

customer_reviews.title: Better than floor!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my recently married son. I wanted to spare his lovely new wife the grief of her husband's clothes scattered on the bedroom floor. He's a wonderful guy but has a very bad habit of throwing his clothes on the floor when tired and undressing. So, you don't know what's clean or dirty. The laundry never stops. I believe this will make a big difference. A Christmas gift...optomistic.
customer_reviews.author: Justine

customer_reviews.title: Solid Random Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those things I didn't really need, but decided to just buy anyways. I was actually pleasantly surprised and we use it way more than i thought we would. It took about 10 minutes to put everything together and it's really sturdy. With my wife and i combined i think we have about 8 jackets on it and 5 or 6 of my hats. My sister actually had this and after seeing theirs we decided to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: C.M

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Every one of the many coats my husband and I own go onto this including my hats. It hold them steady, It doesn't tilt (it has four feet. It took assembly to set it up, but it is worth it. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Uneven/wobbly
customer_reviews.text: Wobbles pretty badly. Tried swapping the legs to see if that was the issue; wobbled even worse. Took it apart and rebuilt following the instructions yet again in case I had missed a step; same result. I ended up having to shim it. Should not happen with a brand new item. Works great now that I’ve shimmed it but shouldn’t have had to do that.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and EZ to assemble
customer_reviews.text: We needed a coat rack that could accommodate multiple shorter jackets and long, heavy parka coats and this fits the bill perfectly. It's a lot sturdier than it looks, especially for the price, is well made and more attractive than the picture. We already have it loaded down with jackets, parkas, hats and an umbrella. Before we got it put together I wasn't sure how sturdy it would be (would loading it up with jackets and coats make it tippy?), but it sits on the floor solidly and does not wobble. Took about 10 - 15 minutes to assemble and there was an Allen wrench included for assembly. Good value!
customer_reviews.author: MarineWife

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad...
customer_reviews.text: Product is as described and pictured however the rigidity could be better, the thing wobbles a bit and you have to bend the metal on the legs to get this thing to sit right and not wobble, at least with the one I got, its not a deal breaker for me just a little annoying to have to do but over all its nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: A decent piece for the money, but came missing a small part
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good coat rack for the money and seems relatively sturdy. Keep in mind that it is not a 50 pound solid wood piece of furniture, but if you distribute your coats or bags it is stable. The one issue I have is that mine came missing one of the small round end caps that covers the rack arms so that it isn't just a sharp tube of metal. Not worth returning and rebuilding another one, but annoying that there is no easy way to contact anyone if I just want to get that small missing piece and not fully return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to get the screws to line up.
customer_reviews.text: This product is not worth $1. I got it today and it took quite a while to put together. I still can't get the top piece on that makes it look good. The base is too small. It tilts when you put a jacket on it so I can only imagine when several are attempting to put their coats on it after school. I do NOT recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Rigney

customer_reviews.title: Must buy!
customer_reviews.text: I am super shocked at how little I payed for such an amazing product! I built it myself and it took me no time. The instructions are very easy to follow and very easy to assemble. The final product is beautiful and worth every penny. It is tall but it has a place for every height. Love it! Would definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Lavi

customer_reviews.title: It really works better than a valet stand.
customer_reviews.text: Nice matte black finish, well balanced stand...plenty big enough for multiple things. A good choice. I’d recommend or give it as a gift, if someone could use a hat/coat rack. I looked at a lot of valet stands that have more features than I really needed, before settling on this.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Vaccaro

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy. Easy. Love it
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I bought this. The price is amazing and it's made my life easier. I hated throwing jackets on chairs or going to closets. It's soooo easy and I was worried that it won't be able to hold my husband's very heavy jacket but it does and never tilts. I have had guests and I love that there is many hooks. Didn't budge. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Great Coat Rack!
customer_reviews.text: Love this coat rack! I am quite impressed with this and looks good in my house. After reading reviews, I decided on this one and happy I did. It is a good weight and sturdy. I hang my (sometimes rather heavy) backpack on it and it doesn't lean or anything. The directions are pictures only-but easy to interpret. Was quite surprised how tall it was when I got it put together since it came in a not very big box. My only complaint is that it does wobble a little, but in my opinion, doesn't take away from the functionality or complete usefulness of the product. Would definitely recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: aprilwine

customer_reviews.title: super annoying to put together
customer_reviews.text: I have put together lots of furniture from Amazon, and I found this coat rack to be an absolute pain. The screws wouldn't fit properly into the holes. And, by the time I figured out that some of the screws just weren't going to fit, it was too late to undo everything and try to return it. I have it put together now in a makeshift way that works fine, but I would highly discourage you from buying this item. Look for something better for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Marie Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Completely Unstable
customer_reviews.text: The feet were totally defective and caused the entire thing to wobble badly. Unusable for sure. The decorative ball was broken off of the screw on top as well. Bunch of the wholes were misaligned and most were not threaded at all. Guessing you either get a terrible one or a descent one. Lets see if number two works any better.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS JUNK..
customer_reviews.text: I am too lazy to return it, but this is one of the biggest pieces of junk i've ever ordered. It's impossible to make level, the pieces are all cheap and not sturdy, i received a crooked screw cap piece. This is a classic example of "you get what you pay for".. my vote is DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY..
customer_reviews.author: JDUNN13

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a very good and sturdy coat rack. The only issue is the ball ornamentation on top was a bit warped when it arrived and, as a result, it leans diagonally. Overall, a good product which I would buy again should the need for a second coat rack arise.
customer_reviews.author: Tad

customer_reviews.title: Uneven Base - Have to Return
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was going well until I got to the base. After putting the base section together, taking it apart and putting it back together again several times (thinking I must have done something wrong), base is uneven and wobbly, even after using the longer screws, as one reviewer recommended. I can get my entire finger under the foot on the "short" side. I would have to put something 1/2" or larger under one leg to make it even. I like the sturdiness of the rest of the item and really wanted this to work, but am disappointed and now have to spend another 1/2 hour taking it apart and trying to repackage it to return.
customer_reviews.author: Beaverton Belle

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy! Love my coat rack.
customer_reviews.text: This coat rack is so sturdy. It has many hooks to hang coats and even purses. I decided not to add the little ball at the top by choice. It came in handy a couple of weeks ago when I had guests over for dinner. Everyone hung their coats and purses with ease and it was so sturdy it with held all the weight well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Tagh

customer_reviews.title: Does not assemble properly and wobbles.
customer_reviews.text: The screws will not fit into many of the holes and some strip as they are going in. The bottom legs are not the same height from the floor, so it wobbles. It looks so nice as you assemble it, but the last 3 feet are horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Louise

product_meta.title: Frenchi Home Furnishing Coat Rack, 73" H
product_meta.description: Color:BlackA classic design in Black metal finish, this coat rack is sure to dress up any home. It is perfect to add a touch of style to your entranceway, or even if you're simply looking for a functional item that will hold your coats. NOTE: For the level issue, we recommend that after finishing assembling, turn the whole rack to left /right a bit or keep turning until customers feel it fit to the ground and leveled.
feature_bullets: Two tiers of coat hooks bring plenty of stylish storage into your living space

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars8,715 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
